diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Abdominal pain, nausea, and weight loss.
diagnosis.relevantHistory: No significant prior medical history or family history of GI cancers.

treatmentPlan.modality: Adjuvant Chemotherapy followed by Adjuvant External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT)
treatmentPlan.systemicChemo: Capecitabine (1000 mg/mÂ² PO BID for 14 days every 3 weeks) - Adjuvant

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in Vac-Lok bag with arms up on wingboard. Patient to follow full bladder / empty stomach protocol. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals).
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT simulation for adjuvant radiation therapy to duodenal bed and regional nodes.

dosimetry.constraints: Kidney Mean < 15 Gy; Liver Mean < 25 Gy; Stomach Max < 45 Gy
dosimetry.planNotes: Adjuvant RT post-Whipple and adjuvant chemotherapy.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily CBCT IGRT. Setup to surgical clips and nodal volumes.
fractions.sideEffects: No acute side effects after first fraction.
fractions.notes: Patient tolerated treatment well. Reviewed supportive care instructions for nausea.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Robert White
progressNotes.summary: Post-operative visit - Tolerating diet well. Surgical drains removed. Awaiting final pathology to guide adjuvant therapy.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Michael Chen
progressNotes.summary: Started adjuvant chemotherapy with Capecitabine. Patient educated on side effects and schedule.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Sarah Lee
progressNotes.summary: Started adjuvant radiation therapy. Tolerating initial setup and treatment without issue.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant (post-operative and post-chemotherapy) radiation to reduce the risk of cancer recurrence in the surgical area and regional lymph nodes.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute: Fatigue, nausea, diarrhea, and potential for skin irritation in the treatment area. Explained that these are usually manageable with medication and diet.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Importance of hydration and nutrition. Reporting uncontrolled nausea/vomiting or diarrhea. Following a low-residue diet if GI side effects occur.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT appointments, report side effects to the team.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use supportive medications (anti-nausea, anti-diarrheal) as prescribed.

cptCharges.description: Radiation treatment delivery, single treatment area, complex
